content: When I run elan-init.sh, it wants to install Elan into ~/.elan/bin. I have limited space available on my home drive, so I'd prefer to install Elan somewhere else. I've tried the "2) Customize installation" option in elan-init.sh, but this does not give the option to change the install directory.
I'd suggest creating a symlink there, that should have the least chance of breakage

Sebastian Ullrich said:

I'd suggest creating a symlink there, that should have the least chance of breakage

Hi, this probably is a good suggestion after having installed somewhere else, but it doesn't solve the problem of installing somewhere else in the first place. Thanks
Did you try it? I would assume that if elan sees an existing ~/.elan it will install in there, irrespective of whether it is a symlink or where it leads to
Ah, I misunderstood what you meant. Works fine with symlinking first and installing second. Thanks!
Björn W has marked this topic as resolved.
